name: Zucchini Noodles with Lean Turkey Marinara
steps:
Using a spiralizer or julienne peeler, create zucchini noodles from all zucchinis. Set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add diced onion and cook for 3-4 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add ground turkey and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, for 6-8 minutes until fully browned and no longer pink.
Season turkey with oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Pour in marinara sauce and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 8-10 minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
While sauce simmers, heat remaining olive oil in a separate large pan over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes, tossing frequently, until just tender but still slightly crisp. Do not overcook.
Season zucchini noodles with a pinch of salt.
To serve: Divide zucchini noodles between plates, top with turkey marinara sauce.
Garnish with grated parmesan cheese and fresh basil.
Serve immediately while hot.
